channel.title: The Conspiracy Skeptic
channel.description: A skeptical look at conspiracy theories. Site: www.yrad.com/cs
channel.itunes:summary: A skeptical look at conspiracy theories. Site: www.yrad.com/cs
channel.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 51 - A Data Skeptic and the Bible Code
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Kyle Polich of the Data Skeptic Podcast comes on to talk about The Bible Code.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 50 - Waco and the Skeptical Vegan
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: James Foley, the Skeptical Vegan, joins Conspiracy Skeptic to talk about the Waco Siege and its implications

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 49 - Blood Moon Means We're in for a Bloody Good Time
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Dr. Stuart Robbins, "Stu" to just me, is back to talk about another end of the world prophesy. Do bad things happen when there are four blood moons in a row that fall on Jewish holidays?

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 48 - Ye Olde Bitcoin Show
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Elder Karl Mamer and Elder Neil Croll talk about bitcoin. Does it have legs? Is the government out to crush it? How much snow would we walk through to earn one bitcoin in 1987?

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 47 - Eight Men Out, Outted
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Mike Bohler returns to talk about the conspiracy to game the 1919 World Series. It's about baseball.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 46 - WIFI WTF?
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Michael Kruse, from Huff Po and Bad Science Watch, gives us a round up on the Wifi Freak Out that's happening in Canada. Is a Canadian University professor right that wifi is a plan to make white suburban people infertile? Have Canadians all gone mad at once?

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 45 - The Squirrels of Mars
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Dr. Stuart Robbins, host of Exposing Pseudoastronomy, is back to talk about his TAM experience, his new World Net Daily Watch project, and whether or not a spaceship and squirrel were found on Mars. Hint: no.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 44 - The Impossible Bomb
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Jakob Thorin (his last name is not pronounced like you might think) comes on to talk about an odd duck who raged all over the JREF board about the impossibility of building a nuclear (fission and fusion) bomb. Just can't happen. Didn't work in 1945. Won't work today. It's just a money grab, folks.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 43 - There are drugs in the water?
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: James Funston is helping get Portlanders on-side with an initiative to fluoridate the water. He's had to take on the whole range of anti-fluoridation arguments and conspiracies.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 42 - A pilot talks chemtrails
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: There was something in the air that night. The contrails were too bright, Fernando. They were gassing you and me. For population control, Fernando.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 41 - Where the D in D20 stands for The Devil
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Your 80s flashback: When we thought role players were baby killing Satanists. Hell, even Tipper Gore thought this.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 40 - Year in Review
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Conspiracy skeptic podcaster Mike Bohler joins this Conspiracy Skeptic podcaster to talk about a year in Conspiracy and what to look forward to.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 39 - Sovereign Citizens and Freemen
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: SGU board member and slave to corporations Derek (aka "SkepticalEsquire: Derek-Albertan") comes on to talk about the freeman/sovereign citizen movements springing up in Canada and the USA.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 38 - Ziggurat on the moon? Huh?
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Dr. Stuart Robbins returns to talk about Mike Barra's claim there's a Ziggurat on the moon and how all great scientific discoveries start on a zombie themed game board. Science, bitches!

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 37 - The Love Conspiracy
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Does love avoid you so much it seems like a conspiracy? Imagine being an atheist among Christians. Conspiracy Skeptic talks to Colorado Skeptic Rich Ludwig about finding a relationship in Christian America.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 36 - Is Income Tax Unconstitutional?
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Your Conspiracy Skeptic Karl Mamer examines whether or not American and Canadian income tax is unconstitutional.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 35 - Joseph Steinberg on the Roanoke Colony Collapse
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Joseph formerly worked in US Army intelligence and now teaches English in Busan, South Korea. He comes on Conspiracy Skeptic to talk about Roanoke Colony, adding some considerable detail to Brian Dunning's Skeptoid episode on the same topic.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 34 - Abbie Smith on the case of XMRV
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Abbie Smith, HIV/retrovirus researcher, returns to talk about a bizarre conspiracy involving scientists that should know better. Or why Big Pharma this time around DOESN'T want to sell you expensive drugs.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 33 - Cures They Don't Want You to Know About
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Tom and Cecil from the Cognitive Dissonance Podcast stop in to talk about their podcast and the "cures they don't want you to know about".

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 32 - The Aetherius Society
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Does the UFO religion Aetherius Society really have irrefutable evidence? Karl examines their claims.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 31 - A year in conspiracy
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Fellow Invisible Sky Monster guest host Michael Bohler and I go over a year in conspiracies.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 30 - African Americans fought for the Confederacy?
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Andrew Philips is a historian and works at a civil war museum. He keeps encountering this over blown claim that slaves and freed men willingly took up arms in defense of the confederacy and their way of life. This knowledge has been suppressed by a vast Yankie Conspiracy.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 29 - The Assassination of Pope John Paul I
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Nigel St. Whitehall (and Lady St. Whitehall), master of the Skeptical Review Blog, returns with another quirky "historical footnote" conspiracy in the same vein as the HMS Invincible. This time it's the treacherous murder of Pope John Paul I, the last of the red hot Italian popes. Cornuto stronzo pimento! (Pointless chat haters: the last 20 minutes is just banter.)

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 28 - Doc Stuart Robbins and 2012 in 2011
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Stuart Robbins is now a newly minted Doctor. Herr Doctor Stuart Robbins returns to Conspiracy Skeptic to fill us in on more 2012 foolishness, Mars foolishness, Billy Meier woo woo, and more.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 27 - The Gay Agenda
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Listener Jeff Syke outlines the religious right's claims about a homosexual agenda and differentiates it from an actual gay agenda.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 26 - Is magic a conspiracy?
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Jacob Jax is a young up 'n' coming magician/juggler in Vegas. He's a TAM veteran. Jacob stops in on The Conspiracy Skeptic podcast to talk about magic, how to get started in what seems like a secret organization, and we tell war stories about punching above our weight in Vegas.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 25 - The Necronomicon
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: JoelWhy is the SGU board's nicest fan of Conspiracy Skeptic. He comes on Conspiracy Skeptic to talk about H.P. Lovecraft and how some people refuse to accept The Necronomicon is not a real book.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 24 - The Georgia Guidestones
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: The Georgia Guidestones have been standing in a weird plot of land since the early 1980s. They've increasingly become an irritant to New World Order conspiracy nuts. Monster Talker Blake Smith is here to talk about his own visit to the Georgia Guidestones.

item.title: Secret New Years Track - Zen for the Hot and Bothered
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Zen for the Hot and Bothered. A reading from the Book of the Browbeaten. The Book of Revelation. A skit from my campus radio show days, circa 1989. See people were doing skeptical comedy 20+ years ago! Oddly I predict the death of CDs and the rise of MP3 players near the end of this skit.

item.title: Secret Christmas Track - Zen for the Hot and Bothered
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Zen for the Hot and Bothered. A reading from the Book of the Browbeaten. Joseph and his Amazing Technicolor Troop jacket. A skit from my campus radio show days, circa 1988.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 23 - Ancient Aliens
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Skeptics' Guide board user Gurmukh Mongia (aka Parrot) has a blog called The Dumbasses Guide To Knowledge. He's slowly working through the truly horrible History Channel series Ancient Aliens and blogging and podcasting about the crap science found on that show. Parrot comes on Conspiracy Skeptic to talk about Ancient Aliens and the claim this knowledge is being suppressed.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 22 - The Face on Mars
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Astronomy doctoral student Stuart Robbins is back to talk about Richard C. Hoagland and his various NASA conspiracies. This is Stuart's last appearance before I have to call him Dr. Robbins. Or maybe Dr. Stu. *tears* I remember him when he was knee-high to a Viking lander!

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 21 - Laurel Canyon, mind control, and the Hippies
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Amira is a hyper cool Canadian chef who travels the world doing her chef thing. The Skeptical Review will soon have an update on what she does and what makes her so damn cool but for now I need to respect her news embargo. So let's just say she's damn cool. Besides being damn cool, she has a damn cool "kitchen sink" conspiracy about the musicians of the hippie generation and how guys like Frank Zappa and David Crosby were CIA stooges in an MKULTRA mind-control op.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 20 - Jack the Ripper
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Listener Charles Smith made a compelling argument to stretch the "conspiracies of the not too distant past" constraint and do a show about the conspiracy theory around Jack the Ripper. You'll find Smith's show a ripping good time! And if you see him at the next Skeptics in a Pub. Buy him a beer! And the cheese plate.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 19 - ZOG
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Neil Croll is a listener and former Canadian neo-nazi skinhead. He's on to talk about his transition to a non-racist middle-aged skeptic and the ZOG conspiracy.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Episode 18 - Crop Circles
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Trystan Swale is the host of the UK's Righteous Indignation Podcast. He's been following the whole crop circle thing for a while now. Swale is on to talk about crop circles, croppies, and the wild eyed conspiracy accusations that swirl around croppies and people that actually make them for giggles.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 17 - David Icke
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Paul Ganssle, Conspiracy Skeptic Listener and skeptic about town, stops in to talk about David Icke and the Reptilian Conspiracy.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 16 - Conspiracy Con X
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Journalist Carolyn Shuck and her friend from the Eastern Establishment came on Conspiracy Skeptic to talk about their experiences at a conspiracy convention. Audio is a bit wonky.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 15 - The Sinking of the HMS Invincible with Nigel St. Whitehall
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Nigel St. Whitehall, blog master of The Skeptical Review, returns with a Falklands War era conspiracy. Claims the Argentinean air force sunk a British aircraft carrier.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 14 - The Protocols of Zion and the Kosher Tax with Jonathan Abrams
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Jonathan Abrams is the host of Canada's SGU "Reality Check", a weekly Skeptical podcast produced by the cracker-jack Ottawa Skeptics crew. He stops in to talk about the Protocols of the Elders of Zion (the Ur-Conspiracy) and the "Jewish Tax on Food" urban legend. We also manage some half-hearted hockey chat in the final minutes. Really compelling stuff.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 13 - North Korean Conspiracies with Stafford Lumsdem
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Stafford Lumnsden of the Seoul Podcast talks about North Korea, Kim Jong-Il, and the $100 super note conspiracy. Plus fan death.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 12 - Satanic Panic with Listener Ryan Davis
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Listener Ryan Davis stops in to talk about the Satanic panic of the 1980s and early 1990s.

item.title: Stuart Robbins and the Strange Case of Michael Horn/Billy Meier
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Stuart Robbins makes yet another appearance to talk about a claim that Billy Meier predicted Apophis.

item.title: Stuart Robbins Update
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Stuart Robbins is back to update us on 2012, a supposed killer asteroid the Russians were yammering about, and a possible supernova neighbor. BTW, think homeopathy is bunk? Check out the 1023 movement. http://www.1023.org.uk/

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 11 - The Family with Steven Cleghorn
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Steven is a long time listener of both my previous podcast Seoul Survivors and the Conspiracy Skeptic. He emailed me about this The Family organization many months before the story broke in podcast land. I wanted to have him on for a chat between two regular Joes about The Family, whether it's an example of a real conspiracy, and the implications. If you don't know much about The Family, I'd suggest first checking out D.J. Grothe's interview with the author himself before tackling my podcast.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 10 - Hayley Stevens on the Princess Di Assassination
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Hayley Stevens is co-host of a funny and thought provoking skeptical podcast produced in the UK. In her spare time she's also a skeptical ghost hunter. On Conspiracy Skeptic we talk about the claims Princess Diana was murdered or even faked her own death.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 9 - Nigel St. Whitehall on the JFK assassination
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Nigel St. Whitehall (a pseudonym) is a mild mannered lawyer from Hershey, PA, creator of the Skeptical Review blog, and a knowledgeable skeptic of claims that Oswald did not act alone.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 8 - Brett Spurr, Money, and China
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Brett Spurr returns to shoot the breeze about some economic ideas held tightly by conspiracy types: can/would China wipe out the economy tomorrow by dumping dollars? Is the gold standard the only real form of money? When we import goods, do foreign countries just make the money we send them disappear and it never comes back?

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 7 - Charles Morrison and the White Salamander Letter
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Charles Morrison stops in to talk about a conspiracy involving the Mormon church.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 6 - Denver Airport Conspiracy with Rich Orman
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Rich Orman from the Dogma Free America podcast stops in to talk about one of the greatest high kookin' conspiracy theories ever: the new Denver airport is Reptoid Base Alpha.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 5 - HIV Denial with Abbie Smith
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Abbie Smith is a grad student at the University of Oklahoma studying HIV. She has a popular blog called ERV (ie endogenous retro virus). Smith takes on creationists, the Disco'tute's head honchos, the top HIV deniers, all the while trying to find a way to keep HIV from killing babies. All that from a person who doesn't own more than 3 small kitchen appliances. Naturally, she stops in to chat with the Conspiracy Skeptic about HIV denial.

item.title: Moon Hoax and Stuart Robbins Revisited
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Stuart Robbins who talked about 2012 on Unplugged Episode 2 is back to talk about the Moon Landing Hoax in the run up to the 40th anniversary of Apollo 11 and the current LRO mission. And yes I know I pronounce Hare Krishna wrong.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 4 - Roswell
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Brett Spurr of the Long Run Blog (a blog about skepticism and finance) talks about the supposed Roswell cover up.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 3 - The Vaccine Conspiracy
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Michael Goudeau stops in to talk about vaccine hysteria, autism, his possible appearance at TAM 7, Penn and Teller's Bullshit, how you (or your boss) can actually hire him to entertain your corporate troops, and a whole lot more.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 2 - 2012 and Planet X
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Stuart is a young, gifted astronomy grad student who takes on creationism and pseudoscience in his blog. In this episode, Stuart discusses some of the attempts by pseudo scientists to explain why the universe is going to try and kill us on December 21, 2012 and why that is so much pure crap.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 1 - The Illuminati
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Guest host Brian Thompson of the Amateur Scientist Podcast. Still working on the sound quality. I have my mike up a wee bit too high and you can hear my sniffling.

item.title: Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged Episode 0 Beta - Holocaust Denial
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: In an effort to keep Conspiracy Skeptic going and turning out shows on a more regular basis, I'm creating a new format called "Conspiracy Skeptic Unplugged" (or more accurately "unscripted"). I will interview a skeptical podcaster or blogger. My former Seoul Survivors podcast cohost Jennifer Booker Young was kind enough to help me do a beta edition to test out the format. The sound quality is pretty crappy on my end.

item.title: Episode 10 - Canadian Conspiracies
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Conspiracy theories in Canada. The Avro Arrow conspiracy and the planned destruction of Canada.

item.title: Episode 9 - The HIV Conspiracy
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: HIV does not cause AIDS? HIV does cause AIDS but it's a bio weapon? HIV does not exist? WTF is wrong with these people?

item.title: Episode 8 - The Free Energy Conspiracy
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Is there a massive conspiracy to suppress too-cheap-to-meter energy?

item.title: Episode 7 - The Big Science Conspiracy
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Is there a Big Science conspiracy? Or is Expelled and Michael Cremo fulla crap?

item.title: Episode 6b - The Fed is Alright
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Is the Federal Reserve system crooked? Comments on the flash film Money, Banking, and the Federal Reserve.

item.title: Episode 6 - The Fed is Alright
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Is the Federal Reserve system crooked? Comments on the flash film Money is Debt.

item.title: Episode 5 - The Moon Landing Hoax
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: The moon landing hoax. The Phil Plait/Joe Rogan debate revisited.

item.title: Episode 4 - Alex Jones and Endgame
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Alex Jones, Endgame, the New World Order, and North American Union.

item.title: Episode 3 - The Great Cancer Conspiracy
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: The great cancer conspiracy.

item.title: Episode 2 - Conspiracy Primer II
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Part II of the conspiracy primer.

item.title: Episode 1 - Conspiracy Primer I
item.itunes:author: The HiveMind Group
item.description: Part I of the conspiracy primer.
